column5: I must of had the video camera on bulge cuz there is no way I put that much weight on. Loony TONner LOL
Nice Brian - congrats on the new toon
That's awesome. I cannot wait until new toy will be fully rigged
Nice rig bud looking good. Art
good to see ya back on the water bud.
Strap on a 327 4-speed, that 55lb stuffÂ isÂ for sissies.

A bit of extra ballast never hurts a boat's stability!Â ðŸ˜‰ Nice rig, Brian.Â  I bought one of those a number of years ago and never even launched it.Â  It was a good idea at the time, but I always ended up taking the Sylvan out fishing rather than haul fifty pounds in to a back lake.............. Doug

I am totally impressed with the outer skin. It is like navy material. Super tough stuff. I was out yesterday and the waves were getting 1ft+. Never felt uncomfortable. I will be picking up a MK Endura C2 30 lb thrust for it.Â  I tried the battery in a milk crate at the bow. That thing didn't even put a dent in the level floating of it. Will now work on setting up the finder on the crate as well. The crate is high enough to make a bracket that will support the transducer off the side. The floating one right now works great, but while it,s bobbing around, I am not getting a real defined pic on the screen.Â  Will post once I have it all rigged up the way I like it and working . Hear salmon are on the move, so might put a dent on that, as I don't really need the motor or the finder for them. Oh wait, the motor comes for the ride back up the river.LOL
Love it ! Cant wait to see the mods !
